channel.title: 54 year old man has sex with a 13 year old girl through Runescape
channel.description:
FITCHBURG, Mass. -- Authorities are calling a suspected child predator "one of the worst people" they've ever seen. The 54-year-old Fitchburg man is accused of crossing several state lines to sexually assault a 13-year-old girl. Police said the way the man met and pursued the teen should serve as a warning to parents. Jeff Phillips allegedly met the 13-year-old Detroit girl while they played an online video game called "Runescape." While role playing in the game, the two entered a cyber marriage, but investigators said Phillips maneuvered for real-life contact. "This guy actually came from Massachusetts to the state of Michigan and had sexual contact with a 13-year-old girl on three occasions," said Sheriff Benny Napoleon. The sex allegedly happened in Phillips' van, at a motel and in the girl's own home. He brought her presents, including her own cell phone, so they could secretly text. "The things that this guy said to this young lady are just unspeakable," said Napoleon. The secret unraveled when her mom caught her using the cell phone at 2 a.m. "She seen her throw her hand. So, she walked over and seen that there was a cell phone there," said Ray Johnson, of the Sheriff's Internet crimes unit. Police raided Phillips' Fitchburg home, but arrested him in upstate New York, where he was visiting his father. Phillips is now in jail. That 13-year-old girl is now in counseling.
Link to the news report [url=http://www1.whdh.com/news/articles/local/12003495494340/fitchburg-man-allegedly-assualts-mi-girl-13/]http://www1.whdh.com/news/articles/local/12003495494340/fitchburg-man-allegedly-assualts-mi-girl-13/[/url]

item.title: 54 year old man has sex with a 13 year old girl through Runescape
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=477832.msg3498959#msg3498959 date=1297577366]

[quote author=Wintercanon link=topic=477832.msg3498957#msg3498957 date=1297577133]

[quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=477832.msg3498944#msg3498944 date=1297575674]

Fucking girl gives Michigan a bad name

Lmfao, Thank god I left that snow-hole.

@Topic - Obviously the girls parents did nothing to protect her, I mean cmon, how the hell do you not know when this dude drives several hours, and happens to get there when her parents are not home? That, or they just didn’t care. I say this is partially the parents fault.

Johnson said the girl’s mother worked two or three jobs and wasn’t home for extended periods of time.

Then her mother should have been a responsible adult and gotten someone to watch her, its that simple. Please, I know how people are in Detroit (as that is where my aunt was killed). They mostly irresponsible, and slow. It took the police 2 and a half hours to drive 3 minutes down the road where my aunt was killed in a car accident. They then proceded to mark her as a ‘Jane Doe’, and the only reason she was found was because of our missing persons report. Please, don’t let that mothers “2-3 jobs” as an excuse hold up. I stil blame the parents, as they STILL could have done something.
[/quote]If she’s working 2-3 jobs I’m guessing she is a single mother and cannot afford to pay for someone to watch her daughter.

Uncles friend has an apartment, $500 with utilities, all they gotta buy is the food/drinks, and whatever they need. I work for $40 a day and seem to make enough to finance a home (and stay ahead on payments). I am sure she could do something if she is working 2-3 jobs. Figure, i’ll do some math for you.

Lets say she works 2 jobs, each on adverage of 25 hours a week (50 hours in total), at, lets guess at minimum wage ($7.50 an hour). This means, her net income per week is $375 even. Lets take out, lets say 15% for income tax, leaving her with $318.75. This is more than I make per week, and if I was able to buy a motorcycle, and truck, my dad a 4-wheeler, and even myself a new laptop, I think she can offored the spare money (or even find family?) that can babysit.
[/quote]And how many kids do you have? You do know kids cost money right…?

No…
Kids dont cost money

The expenses are what your looking for…

Its not “How much for this 1?”
“5 gp”
“SCAMMER, THATS JUST A MIDGET”

“NO I SWER”

Well they do cost money if your going to deliver them through a hospital…

But like i said, its food, things they want, those kind of things that cost money…
[/quote]Kids do cost money. Do you know how much people pay for condoms / birth control, and they always fail?[/quote]
Then how is it my mother supported herself and me back when she was 24 (single mother), had a trailer, paid for the utilities, a babysitter and all, on only minimum wage ($5 or something like that at the time), and still walk out fine. Its the fact that she was good with the money. She worked a burger king, and ended up doing good enough to get promoted into the Manger position (don’t know the wages).

The women in Detroit doesn’t need her internet, that would save money right there. She doesn’t need the computer if she has to work that many jobs, more money saved on electrical. There is something more going on, rather than a 13 year old child. You need to realize there are expenses she is paying, that could easily go over into a babysitter. Clothes? You can just as easily go to a GoodWill or Salvation Army to get cheap clothes. I admit, back when I was broke for like 2-3 months, I was buying my electonics and stuff at GoodWill, since they got a shipment in ever Wednesday of things from Target. Trust me, the women has more going on the just the child to be working 2-3 jobs.

Read full topic

Then her mother should have been a responsible adult and gotten someone to watch her, its that simple. Please, I know how people are in Detroit (as that is where my aunt was killed). They mostly irresponsible, and slow. It took the police 2 and a half hours to drive 3 minutes down the road where my aunt was killed in a car accident. They then proceded to mark her as a ‘Jane Doe’, and the only reason she was found was because of our missing persons report. Please, don’t let that mothers “2-3 jobs” as an excuse hold up. [/quote]

[quote author=The Detroit News (http://detnews.com/article/20110208/METRO01/102080398)]
Johnson said the girl’s mother worked two or three jobs and wasn’t home for extended periods of time.
[/quote][/quote]
Then her mother should have been a responsible adult and gotten someone to watch her, its that simple. Please, I know how people are in Detroit (as that is where my aunt was killed). They mostly irresponsible, and slow. It took the police 2 and a half hours to drive 3 minutes down the road where my aunt was killed in a car accident. They then proceded to mark her as a ‘Jane Doe’, and the only reason she was found was because of our missing persons report. Please, don’t let that mothers “2-3 jobs” as an excuse hold up. I stil blame the parents, as they STILL could have done something.
